structure.unit: PHYSICIANS, OSTEOPATHS, PODIATRISTS, AND RELATED MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS

law.catch_line: Medical emergency -- Approval of additional physician assistants -- Emergency permit.

text.section: As used in this section, "medical emergency" means a real and substantial threat to public health or the health of an individual as determined by the executive director of the board that requires additional professional resources.

In a medical emergency, the board may approve an additional physician assistant for a supervising physician practicing in this Commonwealth for a period not to exceed thirty (30) days who:
Submits satisfactorily completed forms to the board; and
Is licensed and in good standing in this Commonwealth.

In a medical emergency, the board may issue an emergency permit to a physician assistant who:
Is credentialed and in good standing in another state or Canadian province;
Submits satisfactorily completed forms to the board; and
Based on verifiable information, meets the requirements for licensure under KRS 311.844.

law.history: Amended 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 78, sec. 6, effective July 12, 2006. -- Created 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 130, sec. 27, effective July 15, 2002.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/12/2006). 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 78, sec. 11, provides: "A physician assistant who is certified in Kentucky and in good standing on the effective date of this Act [July 12, 2006] shall automatically be licensed under Sections 1 to 10 of this Act [KRS 311.840, 311.842, 311.844, 311.845, 311.846, 311.848, 311.850, 311.852, 311.856, and 311.862] and shall be issued a physician assistant license upon annual renewal."
